alert.note: Alert for Lower Middle Klamath; Upper Smith (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 15 at 2:56AM PDT until August 15 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EARLY THIS MORNING... .Mid level moisture and a hot unstable atmosphere aid in scattered thunderstorm development early this morning. Abundant lightning combined with little if any rainfall will increase the threat for fire starts across dry vegetation. In addition, gusty erratic thunderstorm winds will create dangerous fire weather conditions for ongoing fires. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT EARLY THIS MORNING... The National Weather Service in Eureka has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect until 5 AM PDT early this morning. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 203.Fire weather zone 204. * THUNDERSTORMS...Thunderstorms producing abundant lightning across dry fuels are expected resulting in an increased threat for fire starts. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Erratic outflow winds gusting to 30 mph. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
